name: heat distribution equipment production, hydronic radiant floor heating, 150m2 | heat distribution equipment, hydronic radiant floor heating, 150m2 | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2637/documentation

This dataset represents a floor heating system at low temperature with 40°C of inlet temperature and 30-35°C of return temperature for a one family house in Switzerland. Energy reference area amounts to 165 m2, the heated gross net area is 150 m2. Life time is assumed to be 20 years. A heat pump heating system is chosen.

From reception of the various construction materials (cement, sand, polyethylene, polystyrene, aluminium) at the one family house. 

This activity ends with a floor heating system at low temperature with a life time of 20 years. This dataset includes recycling of the heat distribution system after demolition and the burning of plastic in an incineration plant. This dataset doesn´t include the installation of a buffer storage.
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2815:Manufacture of ovens, furnaces and furnace burners

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: A floor heating system with plastic tubing and aluminum heat conduction fins is chosen to ensure good thermal transfer. For cost reasons in most of the cases no buffer storage is installed. Due to this fact, it is very important to adjust the three cycles (heat use cycle, heat pump cycle, heat source cycle) in the best possible way to ensure optimal heat transfer at all times. ;References:;Persönliche Mitteilung Herr Keel, Zürcher Energieberatung, Zürich, August 1993.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Estimation. 75 m2 of the overall gross net area of 150 m2 are heated from below, the rest of the area is not heated from below (basement).

flow.name: heat distribution equipment, hydronic radiant floor heating, 150m2
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2815:Manufacture of ovens, furnaces and furnace burners

exchanges.description:
Estimation. A floor heating system with plastic tubing and aluminum heat conduction fins is chosen to ensure good thermal transfer. In this dataset it is assumed that heat pipes are installed on the insulation (cross-linked polyethylene pipe, diameter: 20 mm; wall thickness: 2 mm). Pipe distance is 30 cm. The pipes and heat conduction fins embedded in the floor are covered with plastic (polyethylene (LD) 0,2 mm) before the cement screed is applied 6 cm above the pipes with a thickness of 8 cm.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. Isolation consists of 2 cm of polystyrene. (Toschi, 1993). Mass density of polystyrene amounts to 22 kg/m3. (Recknagel, 1988/89). 

Further references:

Recknagel, Sprenger, Hönmann, "Taschenbuch für Heizung und Klimatechnik", Oldenbourg, 1988/89.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Estimation. The pipes and heat conduction fins embedded in the floor are covered with plastic (polyethylene (LD) 0,2 mm) before the cement screed is applied 6 cm above the pipes with a thickness of 8 cm. Cement screed is composed of 300 kg of cement, 1550 kg of sand and 150 kg of water per m3 green mortar (i.e. 2000 kg/m3).
